intro: Watsonamra, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Watsonamra is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and delicate appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
